ArticleTitle.sentence: Retinoblastoma protein expression leads to reduced Oct-1 DNA binding activity and enhances interleukin-8 expression.

AbstractText.sentence: Tumor cell lines with a defective retinoblastoma gene are unable to transcribe the HLA class II genes in response to IFN-gamma treatment, and reconstitution of functional Rb rescues IFN-gamma-induced class II gene expression.

event.clue: Tumor cell lines with a defective retinoblastoma gene are unable to transcribe the HLA class II genes in response to IFN-gamma treatment, and reconstitution of functional Rb rescues IFN-gamma-induced class II gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: However, the molecular mechanism of Rb rescue of the class II genes is unknown.

AbstractText.sentence: We have examined the effect of Rb expression on the activation of the promoter for HLA-DRA, the prototype class II gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Oct-1, a POU domain transcription factor, was identified as a repressor of HLA-DRA promoter activity in the Rb-defective cells.

event.clue: Oct-1, a POU domain transcription factor, was identified as a repressor of HLA-DRA promoter activity in the Rb-defective cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Rb expression led to phosphorylation of Oct-1, thus relieving its repressive effect.

AbstractText.sentence: Oct-1 has also been shown to repress interleukin 8 promoter activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Consistent with reduced levels of Oct-1 DNA binding activity in the Rb-transformed cell lines, interleukin 8 expression is higher in these cell lines.
